data.title: Jaclyn Levine
data.text:
Age you began skating: 6

Year you began coaching: 2005

Jaclyn Levine has extensive training in ballet, studying at Pennsylvania Academy of Ballet, the Kirov Academy of Ballet in Washington D.C., and Nutmeg Conservatory for the Arts in Torrington, CT. Jaclyn was also selected for an exclusive training program where she was one of six dancers coached by Vadim Pisarev and Inna Dorofeeva, of the Donetsk Ballet of Ukraine. Jaclyn spent several years performing with Dance Theatre of Pennsylvania. She has performed in a host of classical ballets including; “The Nutcracker”, “The Sleeping Beauty”, “Cinderella", and “A Midsummer Night’s

Dream”, along with many other classical and contemporary works of various choreographers. Jaclyn has taught ballet all over the Phoenix metro area since 2007. Jaclyn has been training Arizona’s premier figure skaters through her own business, "AZ Ballet for Figure Skaters” at the Scottsdale and Chandler Ice Den’s since 2010. Jaclyn also taught at Master Ballet Academy under the direction of Slawomir and Irena Wozniak, and Scottsdale School of Ballet under the direction of Donald and Sibylle Dadey. Jaclyn has a passion for ballet, and makes it her priority to pass on this love for the art form to all of her students. Jaclyn provides a ballet education that focuses on building a strong technical foundation in a positive, fun, and encouraging environment.

2005-2007: Budzynski Studios of Ballet; 2007-2009: Scottsdale School of Ballet; 2009-present: Master Ballet Academy; 2010- present: Ice Den Scottsdale and Chandler

Year you joined the Ice Den Skating Department: 2010

Dance Education: Jaclyn Levine has extensive training in ballet, studying at Repertory Dance Theatre, Pennsylvania Academy of Ballet, and the Kirov Academy of Ballet in Washington D.C. At 17, Jaclyn attended Nutmeg Conservatory for the Arts’ year-round ballet program in Torrington, CT, where she received training from Alexei Tchernichov and Eleanor D’Antuono. Jaclyn was also selected for an exclusive summer training program in Philadelphia, PA where she was one of six dancers coached by Vadim Pisarev and Inna Dorofeeva, from the Donetsk Ballet of Ukraine.

Specialization/Areas of Focus: Ballet Technique, Artistry on and off ice, Stretch and Strength training.

Career Highlights: Jaclyn spent several years performing with Dance Theatre of Pennsylvania. She has performed in a host of classical full-length ballets including; “The Nutcracker”, “The Sleeping Beauty”, “Peter and the Wolf”, “Cinderella”, “Coppelia”, “A Midsummer Night’s Dream”, “Swan Lake”, and “La Bayadere” along with many other classical and contemporary works of various choreographers.

Achievements: Voted “Best Ballet Teacher in Scottsdale” by expertise.com

Hometown: Scottsdale, Arizona
